instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00298: What is 820-00298? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ( Bad Touch ID button ) will apple help?
threads.message:
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00298</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has a bad Touch ID button.  It was preventing 20v on the charger!  After disconnecting it the machine boots!
Problem is how do I replace it?  Will apple fix it?  Maybe if I disconnect it and give it to them they will replace it.  I am sure when they connect it they will find out it keeps the machine from booting.  What can I do?

Check out my YouTube video to see the details.

[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WgLGLAVSlHQ[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ( Bad Touch ID button ) will apple help?
threads.message:
I wanted to post a update on this repair.  I decided to soak the touch ID button in a Zinc Choride solution for about 10 minutes the power wash it out with a water pick.  That did the trick.  I was able to save the Touch ID button and the machine works.  I posted multiple videos on this as I was repairing the machine on my channel.  

Want to thank who ever made Rubyfluid.  it is amazing stuff.
